sentences.en: Everything gives umbrage to a tyrantny.
sentences.cn: 所有事情都使专制君主生气.

sentences.en: He called me a lily - livered coward, and I umbrage at the insult.
sentences.cn: 他说我是个胆小的懦夫, 这种侮辱让我很生气.

sentences.en: He takes umbrage against anyone who criticises him.
sentences.cn: 不管谁批评他，他都心生愤懑。

sentences.en: He's like you, forever taking umbrage about something.
sentences.cn: 他象你, 总会为了什么事生气.

sentences.en: His address gave umbrage to the authorities.
I invited her because I was afraid ofgiving umbrage.
sentences.cn: 我邀请了她,因为我怕得罪她.

sentences.en: She took umbrage at my remarks about her hair.
sentences.cn: 我对她头发的评论使她很不高兴.

sentences.en: The answers were kept confidential to prevent any partners taking umbrage.
sentences.cn: 为了防止他们的另一半感到不快，他们的答案都是保密的。

sentences.en: The pope himself had taken great umbrage at the book.
sentences.cn: 教皇本人对这本书曾极为生气.

sentences.en: The three camphors are umbrage left by mother, who gave personalized connotation to them.
sentences.cn: 三棵树是母亲给我们留下的绿荫, 是她给三棵树赋予了人格化的内涵.

trans.tran_cn: 生气，（常指无故）不快，树荫，愤怒
